response: narrative=Craig Turnbull, a retired museum exhibitions officer, was reported missing from his home at 10 Inch View, Kinghorn. Last seen by his sister at a nearby petting zoo, Craig had intended to meet Terence Morgan at an amusement park. Concerns rose when he failed to appear as planned. His mother reported him missing after a fruitless search by family and friends, including inquiries at well-known spots like 1 Craig Court, Burntisland, KY3 0AT, and 9 Lowry Place, Rosyth, KY11 2PR, to no avail. Authorities elevated searches upon learning Craig’s routine visits to the bingo hall. Found two days later at 15 Woodside Avenue, Rosyth, Craig was disoriented and admitted he had become confused while attempting to meet Terence. Diagnosed with mild memory impairment, he was reunited safely with family.

narrative=Carl, Craig Turnbull's brother, reported him missing after he failed to return home from an outing to the local amusement park. It was noted that Craig, despite needing assistance due to his disability, decided to venture out alone after discussing plans with his sister, Melissa Turnbull, who had recommended joining her at her book club at 137 Admiralty Road, Rosyth. Craig, however, did not show up at the book club. Concern grew when amusement park staff confirmed seeing Craig leave the premises but not his intended destination. Traced to an unfamiliar address in Crail, investigations suggested he got disoriented and ended up there inadvertently.

After spending the morning looking at the animals, Lydia noticed Craig wandering off towards the exit. Believing he was heading to the restroom, she didn't immediately follow. However, when Craig failed to return, Lydia became concerned and searched the area. Despite her efforts, Craig had disappeared, prompting a police search.
